title.narrative: 4.2 MONITOR OF THE SITUATION OF CHILDREN

description.narrative: Government institutions implement comprehensive and specialized mechanisms to monitor the situation of children and adolescents, and evaluate impact of public policy, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children and adolescents who face multiple deprivations have increased access to pertinent, effective and integrated social protection system taht are properly funded, monitored and evaluated

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty public advocacy (media and social media, campaigns)
Data analysis, including situation analysis and update
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government institutions implement comprehensive and specialized mechanisms to monitor the situation of children and adolescents,and evaluate impact of public policy

description.narrative: The CO worked on strengthening national statistic systems to monitor the situation of children and adolescents in El Salvador, to promote evidence-based analysis and the identification of the main challenges children face, contributing to the progress of the 2030 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).; | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/01/2022
